author: Nick Shepkowski
title: Notre Dame Quarterback Riley Leonard Pays His Offensive Line in Latest NIL Deal
text: Notre Dame QB Riley Leonard Makes Ultimate Teammate Move in Latest NIL Deal One of the biggest takeaways from Notre Dame's 23-13 victory at Texas A&M on Saturday night was that transfer quarterback Riley Leonard didn't get sacked once while dropping back for the Fighting Irish. Perhaps as a result of that, but more likely because he's a good teammate, the Notre Dame signal caller is planning on giving his next NIL deal to the offensive line that protects him. Leonard is slated to be at Dick's Sporting Goods as part of an NIL deal on Friday from 11:30 a.m.-2 p.m. ET. Instead of taking the money (and gift cards) and running however, Leonard is inviting his entire offensive line and letting them all split the payment. Leonard said the following in a statement to [On3 Sports](https://www.on3.com/nil/news/notre-dame-fighting-irish-football-quarterback-riley-leonard-using-nil-deal-dicks-sporting-goods-give-back-offensive-line/): ‚ÄúIt means a lot to be able to share an opportunity like this with my teammates, in fact it‚Äôs essential to me,‚Äù Leonard told On3 in a statement. ‚ÄúI know I‚Äôm the quarterback of this team, but we can‚Äôt win on and off the field if we‚Äôre not doing this stuff together. ‚ÄúI am very grateful to DICK‚ÄôS for giving us the chance to connect with fans in such a fun way as a unit and especially to be able to involve my O-Linemen. Things are always better for everyone when they‚Äôre around.‚Äù [Notre Dame, Leonard, and his offensive line are set to take on Northern Illinois at 3:30 p.m. ET Saturday for the Fighting Irish home opener.](https://www.si.com/college/notredame/football/notre-dame-football-college-niu-preview-how-to-watch-listen-betting-odds-info) [Notre Dame on Sports Illustrated](https://www.si.com/college/notredame/) [Urban Meyer discusses Marcus Freeman's growth following Texas A&M win](https://www.si.com/college/notredame/football/notre-dame-football-news-urban-meyer-marcus-freeman) [Notre Dame Updates Depth Chart Ahead of Northern Illinois Game](https://www.si.com/college/notredame/football/notre-dame-football-riley-leonard-depth-chart-northern-illinois-preview-irish-marcus-freeman) [Notre Dame vs. NIU: How to watch, listen, and bet on Irish home opener](https://www.si.com/college/notredame/football/notre-dame-football-college-niu-preview-how-to-watch-listen-betting-odds-info) [Joel Klatt Gives Very High Praise to Notre Dame](https://www.si.com/college/notredame/football/college-football-news-notre-dame-joel-klatt-rankings-week-2) [Notre Dame Hero From Saturday Learned Valuable Lesson After Huge Play](https://www.si.com/college/notredame/football/notre-dame-college-football-texas-a-m-beaux-collins-sec)

author: PODER360
title: Biden comete gafes na cerim√¥nia de celebra√ß√£o do Dia D
text:
Internautas compartilharam no X (ex-Twitter) momentos considerados ‚Äúconstrangedores‚Äù do presidente dos Estados Unidas, Joe Biden, durante a cerim√¥nia de celebra√ß√£o do 80¬∫ anivers√°rio do Dia D. O evento foi realizado nesta 5¬™ feira (6.jun.2024) na Normandia (Fran√ßa).
Em um dos v√≠deos, o democrata cumprimenta o presidente franc√™s, Emmanuel Macron, e depois trava em uma posi√ß√£o semi-agachada ao quase sentar em uma cadeira atr√°s dele. O registro foi compartilhado pela RNC Research , conta no X administrada pela campanha do ex-presidente Donald Trump e pelo Comit√™ Nacional Republicano.
Formul√°rio de cadastro receba alertas gr√°tis do Poder360 quero receber por e-mail concordo com os termos da LGPD . quero receber no WhatsApp Inscreva-se quero receber no Telegram Inscreva-se ‚ÄúConstrangedor‚Äù , disse a publica√ß√£o ao divulgar a imagem.
Awkward üò¨ pic.twitter.com/3KNLco85hj
‚Äî RNC Research (@RNCResearch) June 6, 2024
O filho de Trump, Donald Trump Jr., comentou o epis√≥dio. ‚ÄúExiste algum momento em que os norte-americanos percebem o quanto isso √© um constrangimento no cen√°rio mundial? Ser√° que esse tipo de incompet√™ncia e fraqueza encoraja nossos inimigos a agirem da forma como est√£o agindo? Claro que sim!‚Äù , escreveu em publica√ß√£o no X.
Outro registro publicado pela RNC Research mostra Biden saindo do local da cerim√¥nia de m√£os dadas com a primeira-dama Jill Biden, enquanto Macron cumprimenta militares e veteranos de guerra que participaram do evento. A p√°gina afirmou que o democrata foi ‚Äúescoltado‚Äù por sua mulher.
Jill, Ed.D., escorts Joe Biden out as French President Macron stays behind to greet veterans pic.twitter.com/n4rpRgdbv5
‚Äî RNC Research (@RNCResearch) June 6, 2024
Usu√°rios compartilharam o registro e questionaram a a√ß√£o de Biden. ‚ÄúJill Biden acabou de retirar Joe do evento na Normandia, enquanto Macron ficou com os veteranos. O que est√° acontecendo?‚Äù , escreveu um internauta.
‚ÄúAs coisas n√£o est√£o indo bem na Fran√ßa. Quando essa farsa de presid√™ncia vai acabar? Joe n√£o est√° bem‚Äù , disse uma usu√°ria do X.
A idade e a aptid√£o cognitiva de Biden t√™m sido temas recorrentes nas redes sociais, com o presidente cometendo diversas gafes durante seu mandato na Casa Branca.
O Wall Street Journal publicou na 3¬™ feira (4.jun.2024) uma longa reportagem detalhando momentos em que o presidente dos EUA demonstrou sinais de desconex√£o em conversas, fechou os olhos e aparentou confus√£o de mem√≥ria.
Ao longo de v√°rios meses, o jornal entrevistou mais de 45 pessoas, incluindo republicanos e democratas que participaram de reuni√µes com Biden ou foram informados sobre esses encontros, al√©m de funcion√°rios do governo.
Segundo o Wall Street Journal, a maioria dos entrevistados que notaram sinais de envelhecimento em Biden pertence ao Partido Republicano, embora alguns democratas tamb√©m tenham relatado situa√ß√µes semelhantes.
DISCURSO DE BIDEN Em suas declara√ß√µes nesta 5¬™ feira (6.jun), o presidente dos EUA afirmou que as ‚Äúfor√ßas sombrias‚Äù que os Aliados (alian√ßa formada pela Fran√ßa, Reino Unido, EUA e, posteriormente, pela URSS) combateram em 6 de junho de 1944, na 2¬™ Guerra Mundial, n√£o desapareceram.
Tamb√©m afirmou que a luta entre ditaduras e liberdade √© ‚Äúintermin√°vel‚Äù e que a Ucr√¢nia √© um exemplo claro disso porque foi invadida por um ‚Äútirano‚Äù.
Segundo o democrata, o Dia D provou que a democracia √© mais forte do qualquer Ex√©rcito do mundo. ‚ÄúO que os Aliados fizeram h√° 80 anos supera em muito qualquer coisa que poder√≠amos ter feito sozinhos‚Äù , disse.
DIA D Em 6 de junho de 1944, tropas aliadas invadiram as praias da Normandia, na Fran√ßa, com o objetivo de libertar a Europa da Alemanha Nazista. A chamada Opera√ß√£o Overlord √© conhecida como a maior manobra militar terrestre da hist√≥ria e marcou o ‚Äúin√≠cio do fim‚Äù da 2¬™ Guerra Mundial e do regime nazista de Adolf Hitler.

author: Billy
title: Frustrated Democrats want Biden to follow asylum limit with immigrant protections
text: House Frustrated Democrats want Biden to follow asylum limit with immigrant protections Hispanic Democrats are ramping up the pressure on President Biden to take unilateral action to protect immigrants living and working in the United States. Members of the Congressional Hispanic Caucus (CHC) are furious that Biden moved this week to put new limits on asylum-seekers without also advancing legal protections for farmworkers, Dreamers and other undocumented immigrants ‚Äî reforms they had presented during a meeting with the president at the White House last month. In the wake of Biden‚Äôs new restrictive asylum policy, they want the White House to launch another round of immigration executive orders to provide some equilibrium between strict enforcement and immigrant rights ‚Äî a difficult balance in an election year when Biden is scrambling to address the border crisis without alienating Hispanic voters. ‚ÄúI think he‚Äôs trying to address half the issue, the half the issue he was able to address. But he needs to address the other piece of it,‚Äù said Rep. Robert Garcia (D-Calif.), a first-term CHC member. ‚ÄúI am hopeful, and so are my conversations with the White House, that there‚Äôs more action coming, and that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm hoping for.‚Äù Rep. Adriano Espaillat (D-N.Y.), deputy chair of the Hispanic Caucus, ticked off a number of reforms at the top of the CHC‚Äôs executive order wish list. These reforms include efforts to shield from deportation the undocumented spouses of U.S. citizens, a group estimated to number more than 1 million; to apply similar protections to the so-called Dreamers, people brought into the country illegally as children and estimated to number more than 3 million; to grant new labor protections and legal rights to immigrant farmworkers; and to expand work permits to include more undocumented immigrants. ‚ÄúI think those four ‚Äî maybe in that order ‚Äî could be interesting pieces that could balance what seems to be an enforcement-only initiative,‚Äù Espaillat said. Those aren‚Äôt the only proposals the CHC is advocating for. The group is also clamoring to expedite ‚Äî or in some cases, simply create ‚Äî a pathway to citizenship for the estimated 12 million undocumented immigrants living in the U.S. Many of those people are already working, paying taxes and feeding into the Social Security and Medicare systems, the Democrats argue, and should be empowered to benefit from those contributions. ‚ÄúHaving an enforcement-only executive order, I think it‚Äôs disappointing, and I think that we really need to make sure that we‚Äôre actually solving the problem, which requires expanding a path to citizenship,‚Äù Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-N.Y.) told reporters shortly before Biden officially rolled out his action. The citizenship pathway has been controversial for decades, however, especially among conservatives who characterize such a policy as ‚Äúamnesty‚Äù for those who broke the law the moment they arrived in the country. In 2014, when House GOP leaders floated a comprehensive immigration reform package that included legal status for the undocumented population, conservatives in their conference killed it within days. And the party has shifted only further to the right since then. With that in mind, some Democrats are suggesting that Biden adopt a more targeted proposal to offer citizenship to those serving in the U.S. armed forces ‚Äî a less contentious concept that could insulate the president from Republican attacks on the campaign trail. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs other conversation about whether or not he can formalize a stronger pathway to citizenship for folks that are serving in the military, strengthening issues around DACA,‚Äù Garcia said. ‚ÄúSo I think that there are ‚Äî and he has done some of that already ‚Äî there are places where more can be done, and I strongly encourage the president to move on this.‚Äù Still, other Democrats are urging the administration to streamline the system for processing asylum-seekers at the southern border, where thousands of migrants are arriving each day. Funding to increase the number of immigration judges was included in a bipartisan Senate deal earlier in the year that was sunk by Republicans after former President Trump came out against the package. But Rep. Juan Vargas (D-Calif.), who represents a border district around San Diego, suggested that Biden can shuffle funding internally to boost that number without congressional action. ‚ÄúThe way to do it is to move resources around within the budget that you have. I think you can do that through executive order, and that‚Äôs what I would like to see,‚Äù Vargas said. ‚ÄúPeople then could apply for asylum, but you could figure out pretty quickly whether they really had a case or it‚Äôs just economic asylum that they‚Äôre asking for, where they don‚Äôt have a case.‚Äù Biden, for his part, has signaled that more action ‚Äî including on the issue of immigration ‚Äî will be on the way after he moved to address the situation at the southern border by unveiling an executive order that would shut off asylum requests when the seven-day average of daily border crossings exceeds 2,500 people ports of entry. ‚ÄúToday, I have spoken about what we need to do to secure the border. In the weeks ahead ‚Äî and I mean the weeks ahead ‚Äî I will speak to how we can make our immigration system more fair and more just,‚Äù he said Tuesday. His decision to go at it alone came after Senate Republicans twice blocked a bipartisan border bill ‚Äî once in February, again in May ‚Äî from advancing, despite it being negotiated by the GOP Sen. James Lankford (Okla.) and hailed as a conservative product. The timing, however, is significant: The situation at the southern border has emerged as a central campaign issue ‚Äî and a key vulnerability for Biden ‚Äî this election cycle. Voters have consistently named immigration and the border as the most important problem facing the U.S. in the lead-up to November, and more have said they trust Trump to address the situation over Biden. Those dynamics led to Biden‚Äôs executive order, which has fractured the Democratic caucus, pitting vulnerable Democrats concerned about the situation at the southern border ‚Äî and looking for something to campaign on in their purple districts ‚Äî against liberals up in arms over what they see as a harsh policy that mirrors moves taken during the Trump administration. ‚ÄúToday‚Äôs executive order severely limits access to asylum and is deeply concerning to our caucus,‚Äù Espaillat wrote in a statement with CHC Chair Nanette Barrag√°n (D-Calif.) and caucus Whip Sylvia Garcia (D-Texas). ‚ÄúSuch measures impede progress and harm migrants fleeing violence and persecution, who otherwise would present a credible and meritorious case for asylum.‚Äù But even within some of the most liberal corners of the Democratic caucus, Biden‚Äôs executive order is splitting progressives. In a move that raised some eyebrows, Rep. Steven Horsford (D-Nev.) ‚Äî a vulnerable lawmaker who chairs the Congressional Black Caucus (CBC) ‚Äî praised Biden‚Äôs move as ‚Äúan essential step to protect our border,‚Äù while Rep. Yvette Clarke (D-N.Y.), the co-chair of the CBC‚Äôs Foreign Affairs and Immigration Task Force, railed against the executive order, arguing that it will ‚Äúprevent countless Black immigrants‚Äù from utilizing their legal right to apply for asylum in the U.S. ‚ÄúWe should move toward a more nuanced approach that considers the real humanitarian issues that migrants are facing each day,‚Äù she added. [Adriano Espaillat]( https://thehill.com/people/adriano-espaillat/ ) [Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez]( https://thehill.com/people/alexandria-ocasio-cortez-2/ ) [James Lankford]( https://thehill.com/people/james-lankford/ ) [Joe Biden]( https://thehill.com/people/joe-biden/ ) [Juan Vargas]( https://thehill.com/people/juan-vargas/ ) [Robert Garcia]( https://thehill.com/people/robert-garcia/ ) [Steven Horsford]( https://thehill.com/people/steven-horsford/ ) [Sylvia Garcia]( https://thehill.com/people/sylvia-garcia/ ) [Yvette Clarke]( https://thehill.com/people/yvette-clarke/ ) Copyright 2024 Nexstar Media Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. More House News House Campaign House House See All Video/Hill.TV See all Hill.TV See all Video

author: Bdaily Business News
title: Thousands of jobs under threat in British Steel closure plans
text:
Thousands of jobs under threat in British Steel closure plans
Thousands of jobs are at risk after a steelmaker unveiled closure proposals.
British Steel has launched a consultation on the future of its Scunthorpe blast furnaces and steelmaking operations.
Bosses say the ventures are ‚Äúno longer financially sustainable due to highly challenging market conditions, the imposition of tariffs and higher environmental costs‚Äù.
Operations ‚Äì which include a rod mill ‚Äì could close by as early as June 2025, affecting as many as 2500 jobs.
The consultation follows the breakdown of talks between British Steel owner Jingye and the Government over investment support for new electric arc furnaces, and comes amid reports the firm has rejected a ¬£500 million Westminster rescue package.
Union Unite has branded the company‚Äôs plans a ‚Äúdisgrace‚Äù, accusing British Steel of ‚Äútrying to hold the Government to ransom‚Äù.
Zengwei An, British Steel chief executive, said the ‚Äúdifficult‚Äù decision comes as the firm battles with ‚Äúsignificant‚Äù losses of around ¬£700,000 a day.
He added: ‚ÄúWe understand this is an extremely difficult day for our staff, their families and everyone associated with British Steel.
‚ÄúBut we believe this is a necessary decision given the hugely challenging circumstances the business faces.
‚ÄúWe remain committed to engaging with our workforce and unions, as well as our suppliers and customers during this time.‚Äù
Responding to the company‚Äôs announcement, Sharon Graham, general secretary at union Unite, ordered the company to revive discussions with the Government.
She added: ‚ÄúThe Government has clearly made an offer to invest heavily in British Steel.
‚ÄúThis offer comes with long-term job guarantees - anything less would be a complete misuse of taxpayers‚Äô money.
‚ÄúBritish Steel must now withdraw its job threats and work with the Government and Unite on a sustainable way forward.
‚ÄúThe UK has the opportunity of becoming a leader in green steel and British Steel should be at the forefront of that transformation.‚Äù

author: Full Strength Network
title: 5 Ways To Measure Your Pastoral Progress
text:
As we stand on the cusp of a new year, it‚Äôs only natural to reflect on where the year has taken us. Growth is a perpetual companion on this path, and measuring it helps us stay aligned with our purpose. It‚Äôs also helpful to take a look back with gratitude for what God has done. It‚Äôs easy to forget as you ramp up into a new year. Let‚Äôs explore five practical ways to gauge your pastoral progress over the past year.
1. Spiritual Milestones and Reflections
Start by revisiting the
spiritual milestones you‚Äôve encountered in the past year. Consider the sermons that resonated deeply, the moments of personal revelation, and the testimonies of transformation within your congregation. Reflect on your own spiritual journey‚Äîhave you deepened your connection with God? Use these reflections as markers of spiritual growth.
2. Impactful Ministry Moments
Think about the ministry moments that left a lasting impact on both you and your congregation. Were there events,
outreach programs, or initiatives that brought the community closer to God? Measure your growth by the positive impact your ministry has had on the lives of those you shepherd. Celebrate the victories, no matter how small, as indicators of your effectiveness in spreading God‚Äôs love.
3. Feedback and Testimonials
Feedback is a powerful tool for growth. Look back at the feedback you received from your congregation, peers, and mentors. Were there common themes or recurring praise? Equally, consider constructive criticism as an opportunity for refinement. Testimonials and stories of transformation provide tangible evidence of the impact of your pastoral care. Let these narratives guide your understanding of your ministry‚Äôs influence.
4. Personal and Professional Development
Pastoral growth extends beyond the spiritual realm to encompass personal and professional development. Evaluate the skills you‚Äôve acquired or honed over the past year. Have you attended workshops, sought mentorship, or engaged in continuous learning? Recognize that personal and professional growth contributes significantly to your effectiveness as a
shepherd.
5. Congregational Connection and Engagement
The strength of a
pastor lies not just in the pulpit but in the connections forged within the congregation. Measure your growth by the depth of these connections. Have you fostered a sense of community? Have you engaged with your congregation on a personal level, beyond the formalities of church services? The relationships you‚Äôve built are a testament to the growth of a vibrant, connected community.
As you reflect on this past year, remember that growth is often subtle, and its impact may not always be immediately apparent. Embrace both the successes and the challenges as opportunities for refinement and improvement. The journey of a pastor is a continuous cycle of growth and learning, and each year brings new insights and experiences.
May the lessons of the past year fuel your passion for the ministry, and may you continue to grow in grace and wisdom in the year ahead.
This article originally appeared
here.

author: dpa
title: Gewerkschaft verk√ºndet Tarifeinigung bei D√∂nerfabrik Birtat
text:
Murr. Im Tarifkonflikt beim D√∂nerspie√ü-Hersteller Birtat gibt es eine Einigung - es ist zugleich nach Gewerkschaftsangaben der erste Tarifvertrag in der D√∂nerfleischindustrie. F√ºr die rund 120 Besch√§ftigten wurde der Einstiegslohn auf 2.600 Euro festgelegt, wie die Gewerkschaft Nahrung-Genuss-Gastst√§tten (NGG) und das Unternehmen Meat World SE (Birtat) in Murr bei Ludwigsburg gemeinsam mitteilten. Ferner sei eine Anhebung der Entgelte in zwei Stufen im Gesamtumfang von bis zu 17 Prozent in der Spitze bei einer Laufzeit bis Ende 2026 vereinbart worden. F√ºr eine direkte Stellungnahme war das Unternehmen zun√§chst nicht erreichbar.
AdUnit Mobile_Pos2 AdUnit Content_1 Die Gewerkschaft NGG forderte eine Erh√∂hung der Entgelte um 375 Euro und einen Tarifvertrag. Bisher wurde die Arbeit an elf unterschiedlichen Tagen zeitweise niedergelegt. NGG-Verhandlungsf√ºhrerin Magdalena Kr√ºger sagte, dieser Tarifabschluss sei ein historisches Ergebnis in der D√∂nerfleischbranche und ein Erfolg der Besch√§ftigten.
